thread.title: Canadiens’ Price takes note of Rangers’ goalie in home opener
thread.title_full: Canadiens’ Price takes note of Rangers’ goalie in home opener

author: SEAN GORDON
title: Canadiens’ Price takes note of Rangers’ goalie in home opener
text:
Montreal Canadiens goalie Carey Price (31) makes a save during the third period against the New York Rangers on Thursday, Oct. 15 at the Bell Centre in Montreal. (Eric Bolte/USA Today Sports) Canadiens’ Price takes note of Rangers’ goalie in home opener SEAN GORDON MONTREAL — The Globe and Mail 
Published Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 1:55AM EDT 
Last updated Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 2:14AM EDT 
Hockey players watch the games too; they’re allowed to be fans. 
About 20 minutes after shutting out the New York Rangers for the sixth time in his last ten home starts, you may be surprised to learn Montreal Canadiens goalie Carey Price’s prevailing emotion was admiration for his opposite number. 
The Habs have won their first five starts this season – a new record for a 106-year-old franchise where it seems basically everything has been done at least once – none of the previous four triumphs involved a goal-tending duel of this standard. Never miss out
